column5: Hey guys, In July I will be headed up to sandbanks PP and hoping to get into some fish. I will be only fishing close shoreline as I'm in a canoe and early morning and calm nights, just wondering if you guys have any fishing advice and what's in there anyway! Thanks guys
West lake, just down the way.
When I was a kid I watched a kid hook another kid in the wrist after casting under the bridge.  Seemed that was the place to fish.... but just watch out for kids fishing. lol.
Yep, West Lake can be good for walleye, presumably bass, there are also pike and crappie.  East Lake same.  Good luck.

Ok, now I haven't camped there in years( but LOVED it when I did ).  I remember fishing in May and getting pike and walleye in the river right in the park.  I beleive there's was bass and carp in there as well.  Good luck.  A great park with one of the best beaches around.
used to go there every year when I was a kid. Pike ,bass, pickerel in both east lake and west lake. Which lake do you plan to target?
Any info on the trip yet?

Got into some bass on the outlet river and just into east lake, nothing huge but some decent 2 pounders. Other then that didn't get out as much as I wanted as the whole family came down with big sinus colds and the beach was shut down due to E.coli, to sum it up the trip stunk
That sucks...we just bought a farm on PEC, didnt realize it was closed for ecoli, yuck!
